attributes.action: Reject the possibility of leaving the European Union with no agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
The post-Brexit vision given to the British People was set out by the official Leave campaign in their pre-referendum booklet:
https://view.publitas.com/vote-leave/why-vote-leave-1/page/1
Key to that vision was that the UK would leave with a deal:
"There is a free trade zone stretching all the way from Iceland to the Russian border. We will still be part of it after we Vote Leave"
It is untenable to suggest the British Public have given support to a "No-Deal Brexit"
attributes.background:
The British Government claims justification to leave the EU based upon the votes cast in the referendum of 23/06/16.
Prior to the vote, the Leave campaign set out its vision: 
Leaving with a Deal - remaining in the single market.
There is no basis to suggest the British People support "No Deal".
